mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, George Washington to Nathanael Greene, 1779 March 13
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Washington, George, 1732-1799
mdRecord.dcterms:description: While encamped at Middlebrook, New Jersey for the winter of 1779 George Washington wrote this letter to Nathanael Greene about trading one of his horses for another. Washington must have remember that Colonel (John) Cox had admired his horse ("my white faced black, on acct. of his strength & abilities") and looking to trade, offered this horse for another “horse not equal in size appearance, or value, but more agreeable to me in point of colour.” Autograph letter signed, 2 pages, with integral address panel.
